original: Arnborg, Johan (John) Alfred, köpman, fil. kand., Halmstad, f. 15/3/90 i Halmstad. G. 1. 18-22 m. Ragni Bün-sow; 2. 30 m. Mimi Buchner. Barn: Bengt J. R. f. 19. — Stud :ex. i Halmstad 10, stud. v. Upps. univ. 10-20, fil. kand. 19, språk- o. museistud. i Tyskl. 20-22 o. i Köpenhamn på ferierna 23-27. Assist, v. prof. C. M. Fürsts antropolog. lab. 23-30, vik. lär. v. Neder-kalix samrealsk. 31, statsunderstödd föreläs, v. Lunds centr :byrå 23-40, verks. s. språklär. o. tolk samt anst. v. Halmstads hand:inst. 34-35, inneh. av Försäkr:bol. Zürichs huv:agentur i Hall. sed. 36. Skr.: En avhandl. om människobenrester fr. Danm. äldsta stenålder (Meddel. fr. Dansk Naturh. Foren. Bd 80, 25), ett flert. vet:skapl. upps. samt ref. i tidskr. o. tidn :upps. spec. i antropologi, arkeologi men även i hist., geogr. o. allm. akt. ämnen, medarb. i bl. a. Eberts Reallexikon der Vorgeschichte, Antropologischer An-züger o. Die Eiszeit m. art. rör. nord. antropologi o. arkeologi 26-30, över- sätt. av fackvetenskap o. hand :kor-resp. sed. 26. Hobbies: forn-, hembygds- o. släktforskning.
translated: Arnborg, Johan (John) Alfred, merchant, B.A., born in Halmstad on March 15th, 1890. Married 1st wife Ragni Bün-sow from 1918-1922; married 2nd wife Mimi Buchner in 1930. Children: Bengt J. R. born in 1919. He took his student exam in Halmstad in 1910, studied at Uppsala University from 1910-1920, graduated with a B.A. in 1919, and pursued language and museum studies in Germany from 1920-1922 and in Copenhagen on holidays from 1923-1927. He was an assistant at Professor C.M. Fürst's Anthropological Laboratory from 1923-1930, a substitute teacher at Neder-kalix samrealsk in 1931, a state-supported lecturer at Lund's central office from 1923-1940, worked as a language teacher and interpreter, and was employed at Halmstad's trading institution from 1934-1935. He held the position of head of Zurich Insurance Company's main agency in Halland from 1936. He wrote a paper on human bone remains from Denmark's earliest Stone Age (Meddel. fr. Dansk Naturh. Foren. Bd 80, 25), as well as numerous scientific papers and reviews in journals and magazines, specializing in anthropology, archaeology, as well as general historical, geographical, and topical subjects. He contributed to works such as Ebert's Reallexikon der Vorgeschichte, Antropologischer An-züger, and Die Eiszeit with articles on Nordic anthropology and archaeology from 1926-1930. He also translated scientific and trade correspondence starting in 1926. His hobbies included researching ancient times, local history, and genealogy.

structured.name: Johan Alfred Arnborg

occupation.roleName: Head of Zurich Insurance Company's Main Agency in Halland

memberOf.name: Meddel. fr. Dansk Naturh. Foren. Bd 80

structured.description: Johan Alfred Arnborg was a Swedish merchant and B.A. born on March 15, 1890 in Halmstad. He studied at Uppsala University from 1910-1920 where he graduated with a B.A. in Philosophy. In the early 1920s, he pursued language and museum studies in Germany and Copenhagen. Arnborg worked as an assistant at Professor C.M. Fürst's Anthropological Laboratory from 1923-1930, a substitute teacher at Neder-kalix samrealsk in 1931, and later became a state-supported lecturer at Lund's central office from 1923-1940. He also worked as a language teacher, interpreter, and was employed at Halmstad's trading institution from 1934-1935. From 1936, he held the position of head of Zurich Insurance Company's main agency in Halland. He wrote numerous scientific papers and reviews in journals and magazines, specializing in anthropology, archaeology, as well as general historical, geographical, and topical subjects. Johan Alfred Arnborg enjoyed researching ancient times, local history, and genealogy. Johan was married twice, to Ragni Bün-sow from 1918-1922, and later to Mimi Buchner in 1930. He had one child, Bengt J.R., born in 1919.
